sen.e: TAIRA no Tokiie (? - June 5, 1199) was a busho (Japanese military commander) and a noble during the late Heian period and early Kamakura period.

sen.e: Even though he belonged to the Taira family, Yoritomo favored him because he was knowledgeable in kemari (a game played by aristocrats in the Heian period), Kangen (gagaku piece without dance) and court manners, and since Tokiie himself also held a grudge because of the incident in the past, he decided to faithfully serve Yoritomo, who otherwise should have been his enemy.

sen.j: 後に義父・上総広常は粛清され、平家も滅亡するが、頼朝からの信頼は変わらず、また頼朝の家臣団では最高位の位階を持つ人物として内外からの尊敬を集めた。
sen.e: Even though his father-in-law, Hirotsune KAZUSA, was later purged, and the Taira family fell, Yoritomo's trust in him remained unchanged, and he was respected from within as well as from the outside as someone who held the highest position among the members of Yoritomo's vassals.
